art.author: Albert Einstein
art.quote: I am enough of an artist to draw freely upon my imagination. Imagination is more important than knowledge. Knowledge is limited. Imagination encircles the world.

categories.author: Paul W. Silver
categories.quote: Instead of making prisoners out of our students, we ought to make students out of our prisoners.

life.author: Robert Brault
life.quote: Enjoy the little things, for one day you may look back and realize they were the big things.

management.author: Theodore Roosevelt
management.quote: Great thoughts speak only to the thoughtful mind, but great actions speak to all mankind.

love.author: Francois de La Rochefoucauld
love.quote: True love is like ghosts, which everyone talks about and few have seen.

sports.author: Dale Earnhardt
sports.quote: You win some, lose some, and wreck some.

inspiring.author: Charles Bukowski
inspiring.quote: The free soul is rare, but you know it when you see it - basically because you feel good, very good, when you are near or with them.

funny.author: Steven Wright
funny.quote: You know how it is when you're reading a book and falling asleep, you're reading, reading... and all of a sudden you notice your eyes are closed? I'm like that all the time.
